"We believe that The Theatre is a definite part of the civic and social life of our community.  Its chief purpose is to afford every individual who really desires it, the opportunity for self-expression in the Arts of the Theatre."
Published 1938

Leadership at St. Petersburg City Theatre
Stefanie Lehmann President
Kari Kennedy                       VP Back of House
Nathaniel Beaver               VP Front of House
Stefanie grew up at City Theatre where she first joined as a chorus member of The Music Man in 2004. Her day job is with Lincoln Center as their Associate General Manager but when off the clock she can be found back or front of house helping to keep this beloved company thriving.
Nathaniel Beaver               VP Front of House
Kari Kennedy                       VP Back of House
Nathaniel Beaver               VP Front of House
Coming soon
Kari Kennedy                       VP Back of House
Kari Kennedy                       VP Back of House
Kari Kennedy                       VP Back of House
Kari is the kind of person every theatre dreams of having on their team...a true spark of joy who is always ready to pitch in. After moving to St. Pete in 2020, she quickly found her creative family at SPCT and has been an integral part of the theatre ever since. Show More
Kari is the kind of person every theatre dreams of having on their team...a true spark of joy who is always ready to pitch in. After moving to St. Pete in 2020, she quickly found her creative family at SPCT and has been an integral part of the theatre ever since. By day, Kari keeps things structured and organized as a Program Manager, but by night she dives into the magic of theatre, building imaginative sets, “MacGyver-ing” props from the most unexpected materials, and rallying volunteers to help the cast shine. Her energy, creativity, and can-do spirit help transform every production into an experience that dazzles our audiences and strengthens our community.
Show Less
Stacie Lehmann Secretary
Lisa Marone          Treasurer
Kari Kennedy                       VP Back of House
Stacie is a retired preschool/ elementary teacher and former employee of Pinellas County and the City of St  Petersburg. Since encouraging her daughter to audition for her first show, she has volunteered for over 20 years and done a little bit of everything: production coordinator, props,  painting, set dressing, sound & light ops, and, most often, as a Mainstage costume designer.
Lisa Marone          Treasurer
Lisa Marone          Treasurer
Lisa Marone          Treasurer
Lisa is a networking queen who has spent over 15 years volunteering, event planning, promoting and  friend/fundraising for her favorite non-profits in St Petersburg and St  Pete Beach. Her PR and communications organization PEACE In The Burg connects local businesses with nonprofits for collaborative cause related marketing.
Christine White
Lisa Marone          Treasurer
Lisa Marone          Treasurer
Christine is a hair stylist and a proud SPCT Lifetime Member, first joining in 1982. She has done over 54 shows in various positions over those years, most recently as a director for some of SPCT's favorite Mainstage musicals.
Rei Capote
Vaughn Wassmer
Vaughn Wassmer
Rei is a Miami born and raised actor who has been in the theatre business since they were a teen. They have taken acting courses at UM, Cambridge University UK, and got their degree in Theatre at FIU. They have worked as a professional actor in TV shows and short films as well as many small professional theatre's around Florida. Rei has a
Show More
Rei is a Miami born and raised actor who has been in the theatre business since they were a teen. They have taken acting courses at UM, Cambridge University UK, and got their degree in Theatre at FIU. They have worked as a professional actor in TV shows and short films as well as many small professional theatre's around Florida. Rei has always had a passion for teaching and acting; they are fortunate to utilize both at SPCT as a part of the youth program. Away from the theatre they enjoy spending time with their cats at home, going to theme parks, drinking fancy coffee at coffee shops, reading, and, since becoming a new parent, hanging out with their infant.
Show Less
Vaughn Wassmer
Vaughn Wassmer
Vaughn Wassmer

Vaughn Wassmer
Kevin Crowell   Administrator
Coming soon
Kevin Crowell   Administrator
Mardi Bessolo               Past President
Kevin Crowell   Administrator
Kevin is the heartbeat of our theatre. He wears many hats...overseeing building maintenance, designing and constructing sets, and making sure the space shines before every performance. As administrator of our thriving youth program, he guides the next generation of performers with care and enthusiasm. He’s also the central hub of communic
Show More
Kevin is the heartbeat of our theatre. He wears many hats...overseeing building maintenance, designing and constructing sets, and making sure the space shines before every performance. As administrator of our thriving youth program, he guides the next generation of performers with care and enthusiasm. He’s also the central hub of communication, keeping everything running smoothly behind the scenes. His dedication ensures that our theatre not only thrives but continues to feel like a second home for our community.
Show Less
Mardi Bessolo               Past President
Mardi Bessolo               Past President
Mardi Bessolo               Past President
Mardi is a CFO and business owner with a background in accounting and computers. When her shy daughter was 6, she got her involved with the theater to help develop her confidence. Mardi helped lead the efforts of an amazing group of people who saved the theater from closing in 2017 and previously served as Board President.
Jamie Bierchen             Past President
Mardi Bessolo               Past President
Mardi Bessolo               Past President
Jamie is an international consultant who has traveled to over 70 countries. He has directed, choreographed, and acted in shows at SPCT and around the TB Area and previously served as SPCT's President.
The Board of Directors meets every other month. Meetings are open to all Active Members. If you are a Member who would like to listen in or are a Member who would like to formally request time on the agenda to discuss something with the Board, please contact office@spcitytheatre.org
Attend A Meeting

Hurrican Milton Destruction at St. Petersburg City Theatre Theatre
Like so many in our Tampa Bay community, this hurricane season has not left us unscathed. As we were counting down the final months until 2025 and our 100th anniversary, Hurricane Milton blew in and blew the roof right off our beloved community theater. But this one-hundred-year storm is no match for our one-hundred-year organization. You will see from the video
here
that our building was deeply affected and critical repairs are rapidly needed; a large portion of our roof was peeled off, allowing significant water into the venue. Even so, St. Petersburg City Theatre has long stood as a sanctuary to all members of our community, and we have absolute faith that our incredible volunteers will help us recover and restore the magic of live theater.
We are making every effort to ensure the brave girls, lost boys, and pirates of our Fall Youth Camp production of Peter Pan Jr. can continue as scheduled, as well as our December Mainstage Musical, Irving Berlin’s White Christmas. We believe now, more than ever, we need a place to come together and forget our troubles. As the White Christmas song goes, “Skies were gray but they're not gray anymore…Blue days, all of them gone. Nothing but blue skies from now on.”
WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
*Volunteer with Us: We're seeking individuals to assist with immediate clean-up and minor repairs on Saturday, October 19th from 9:00am-3:00pm. Details are in the Facebook event post
here
. Whether you can lend a hand for a couple hours or help organize efforts, every bit counts! If you would like to volunteer your time in other ways, please reach out by commenting below.
Donate Today: Your contributions will directly fund our recovery efforts. No amount is too small, and every single dollar will help us. We unfortunately do not have hurricane coverage in our insurance policy so will be paying for all repairs and replacements from donations. All donations over $100 are recognized in every show program. Please CONSIDER DONATING TODAY at:
https://stpetersburgcitytheatre.givingfuel.com/annual-donations
You can also click on the donate header our website
www.spcitytheatre.org
to learn about other ways to give, including the centennial brick and seat plate fundraisers, legacy gifts, and in-kind donations.
Offer Consultation or Referrals: If you have a specific skill, trade, or piece of equipment that may help with our current challenges, please reach out. In the **immediate**  term, we need to get a temporary tarp/cover on the roof to prevent further leaks and a large capacity roll-off dumpster to collect debris and damaged items for disposal. We would welcome referrals or recommendations of trusted vendors that could assist ASAP, especially any that may offer discounts to a local nonprofit. We will happily post and share about any companies who come to our aid. After we ensure we’ll be dry, we will need to repair/refinish the stage surface, clean the auditorium carpets and stage curtains, test our theatrical systems to ensure everything is safe and functional, and much more. Please don’t hesitate to contact us if you have any abilities or information that might be of assistance in the difficult time.
Thank you for your support. For our numerous members, volunteers, students, and audience members who are facing their own losses from Hurricanes Helene and Milton, our hearts are with you and we are so sorry that you are going through this.
For many this theater is a home, and its members are family. We refuse to close our doors when there are so many people in need of a place to find joy in gathering, growing, uniting, and inspiring each other. We will rebuild and continue to serve our Tampa Bay Area, an example to the power of a diverse and passionate community connected through the arts!
